poem:
"Ode to Justice Slowly Roused"

Wake, outfielder of truth, emerging
like a drunken snail, you claw through dark soil.
You in your robe of night, unwrapping old wounds.
You break the hush of stained glass and bone,
constrain silent cries to echo in chambers once locked.
To bring us around the hot stove of justice,
where even the dead can be held accountable.
